author: Erin Ailworth
title: Ohio Power Company Has Few Allies in Bailout Bid
text:
FirstEnergy Corp. is waging a lonely fight as it seeks to persuade the Trump administration to bail out its struggling coal and nuclear-power plants through an unprecedented emergency action that experts say would effectively end Americaâ€™s largest competitive electricity market.

The Ohio-based utility doubled down on coal and nuclear power in 2010 when it struck a deal to buy Allegheny Energy Inc. for $8.5 billion, just as fracking in the nearby Marcellus Shale formation started to unleash a gusher of cheap natural gas that...
